a-central-location-to-ingest-host-and-sy:
A central location to ingest, host, and synthesize multiple data sources about their communities, facilitating a more holistic analysis and decision-making
Major data sets, such as Transportation Disadvantaged tracts, bikeshare stations, job sites
The ability to upload your own agency-specific data sets into Remix
agencies-selected-for-participation-in-t: Agencies selected for participation in this program will be required to:
All licenses are set to expire on October 31, 2027. At the end of the license term (10/31/27), access to the platform will end. Current options to extend/renew exist in the form of purchasing via the Software Licensing Program (SLP).
apply-to-join-remix-program: Apply to join the Remix Program
apply-to-join-the-remix-program: Apply to join the Remix program
at-this-time-we-cannot-make-an-exact-det: At this time, we cannot make an exact determination on when an individual agency may be eligible for funding. We encourage agencies to apply as early as possible, regardless of whether or not they are immediately eligible, as we aim to continuously admit qualifying applicants as soon as capacity allows.
both-of-these-modules-include-remix-expl: Both the Transit and Scheduling modules include Remix Explore, a geospatial data visualization and analysis tool that lets you bring your data together in one place.
by-having-remix-agencies-gain-access-to: With Remix, transit agencies gain access to:
by-offering-remix-to-qualifying-agencies: By offering Remix to qualifying agencies for free, Cal-ITP aims to:
fill-out-an-intake-form-to-apply-for-a-f: Fill out an interest form to apply for a free Remix license. The form should take about 10-15 minutes to fill out. You’ll share information about your current vendors, scheduling processes, and GTFS pipeline.
for-a-more-detailed-overview-of-how-remi: For a more detailed overview of how Remix works, as well as the different modules available, we suggest watching the demos featured on their website. Please note: The Cal-ITP Remix Program does not offer access to the Streets module. To learn about all the products Remix has to offer, visit their website.
how-many-seats.licenses-are-available-fo: How many seats/licenses are available for access once accepted to the program?
if-my-agency-already-has-remix-can-we-st: If my agency already has Remix, can we still apply?
if-my-agency-doesnt-qualify-immediately-: If my agency doesn’t qualify immediately, how long will we have to wait to get our license?
if-you-have-questions-about-your-eligibi: If you have questions about your eligibility based on past funding, please see Commonly asked questions. If you do not qualify for this program, you can still purchase directly off the Software Licensing Program (SLP). Reach out to your Cal-ITP Account Manager or hello@calitp.org for assistance.
licenses-distributed-through-this-progra: Licenses distributed through this program will include:
program-benefits-: How Remix can help your agency
qualified-and-admitted-agencies-particip: Qualified and accepted agencies participating in the Remix pilot will have unlimited access for all users for the duration of the program.
reduce-barriers-to-procuring-software-fo:
Help smaller transit providers plan, schedule, and report on operations more efficiently 
Make it simpler for agencies to produce and maintain high quality GTFS, or General Transit Feed Specification
remix-gtfs-publisher-serves-as-a-single-: Remix GTFS Publisher serves as a single source of truth for your fixed route system. Save time and meet the FTA compliance requirements with easy-to-use, self-serve tools. You can update your feeds while planning and scheduling your services, all in one place.
remix-is-a-software-as-a-service-saas-pl: Remix is a software platform that allows transit agencies and cities to better plan public transportation systems and more easily schedule transit service.
remix-scheduling-allows-you-to-take-your: Remix Scheduling allows you to take your plans from vision to implementation with nimble and intuitive software for blocking, runcutting, and rostering. It allows you to improve operational efficiency while saving your agency resources and staff time.
remix-transit-the-worlds-first-planning-: Remix Transit, the world’s first planning platform for fixed route transit. From small detours, to GTFS management, to full system redesigns, you can plan, evaluate, and collaborate on transit updates.
share-information-on-their-existing-tech:
Share existing tech stack and relevant tech vendor contracts with Cal-ITP
Address any outstanding issues with their GTFS feed with the assistance of Cal-ITP and the Caltrans Transit Data Quality Team
Attend regular check-ins and Remix trainings with their Cal-ITP Account Manager
Provide administrator-level Remix account access to Cal-ITP to allow for technical assistance and product fit analysis
Participate in regional coordination of the Remix implementation
the-goal-of-this-program-is-to-make-it-s: This program will help streamline transit operations and provide a better transit rider experience through accessible Remix software procurement and access.
the-remix-program-is-an-initiative-conce:
If your agency has received 5311 funding or a combination of 5311 and 5307 funding in the past three years, you’re eligible to apply for a free Remix license through this program.

The project is administered by Cal-ITP via support from Account Managers, and agencies will continue to receive technical support from both Cal-ITP and Remix for the duration of the license.
there-is-also-an-expectation-for-partici: There is also an expectation for participating agencies to utilize Remix as your primary tool for maintaining and publishing schedule data including the GTFS Schedule information submitted to trip planners and any CAD/AVL systems.
tk: Software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform that allows transit agencies and cities to better plan public transportation systems and more easily schedule transit service.
when-does-the-free-license-expire-and-wh: When does the free license expire? And what happens after it expires?
while-priority-in-year-one-will-be-given: We will extend access to 5311 + 5307 as soon as capacity allows, or once year two of the program begins.
with-a-limited-number-of-licenses-availa: With a limited number of licenses available, during the first year of the program, priority will be given to agencies who have received only 5311 funding in the past 3 years. However, agencies who have received 5311 and 5307 funding are still encouraged to express their interest through the intake form.
within-30-days-of-submitting-the-intake-: Within 30 days of submitting the interest form, agencies will be notified of whether or not they are eligible. Access to Remix Planning will be granted to eligible agencies within 7 days of that notification. Participating agencies will receive training and onboarding resources as well as access to Remix Scheduling and Remix GTFS Publisher within 30 days of the first login.
yes.-other-eligibility-requirements-stil: Yes. Other eligibility requirements still apply. Please note if you’re actively using Remix and apply for a free license through the program, you may have some additional eligibility considerations that will be evaluated on a case by case basis. If you have questions about your existing contract, please share them directly with your contact at Remix.
